Discover the wonders of science, technology, engineering, math, biomedicine, artificial intelligence, and more! 2025 Fair HOURS Friday, January 17: 12 PM – 10 PM Saturday, January 18: 10 AM – 10 PM Sunday, January 19: 10 AM – 10 PM Monday, January 20: 10 AM – 10 PM Tuesday, January 21: 12 PM – 10 PM Wednesday, January 22: 12 PM – 10 PM Thursday, January 23: 12 PM – 10 PM Friday, January 24: 12 PM – 10 PM Saturday, January 25: 10 AM – 10 PM Sunday, January 26: 10 AM – 10 PM Monday, January 27: 12 PM – 10 PM Tuesday, January 28: 12 PM – 10 PM Wednesday, January 29: 12 PM – 10 PM Thursday, January 30: 12 PM – 10 PM Friday, January 31: 12 PM – 10 PM Saturday, February 1: 10 AM – 10 PM Sunday, February 2: 10 AM – 8 PM *The Midway opens an hour after the gates open. Experience Fright Nights Behind The Scenes FAQs Directions Haunts & Scare Zones  > 2025 Haunts Past Haunts Cast  > Icon Characters Featured Characters About Us Buy Tickets Search Website Search Area Weather Buy Tickets Search Website Search Buy Tickets Search Website Search Hours & Directions Login Our Partners Buy Tickets Search Website Search Tickets Home > Kubota AGZone > Events > Book Your Event Book Your Event ONE OF THE PREMIERE AGRICULTURAL FACILITIES IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA AND A MULTI-PURPOSE EVENT LOCATION IN THE HEART OF PALM BEACH COUNTY Centrally located in Palm Beach County, the South Florida Fair AGZone provides easy access from all parts of "booming" South Florida by both Interstate 95 and the Florida Turnpike, the AGZone at the South Florida Fairgrounds offers 51,000 usable square feet of exhibit space (That's enough for over 150 ten-by-ten exhibit booths, a large automotive or boat show and a variety of other events looking to attract a large audience.) ideal for: Agricultural Events Special Events Equestrian Shows Trade & Consumer Shows Book your event now! of Transcript FLEXIBLE FACILITIES Big enough to handle your largest event, small enough to provide outstanding service, the AGZone Buildings at the South Florida Fairgrounds offer over 51,000 square feet of usable floor space. That's enough for over 150 ten-by-ten exhibit booths, a large automotive or boat show and a variety of other events looking to attract a large audience. AGZone SERVICES & SUPPORT No matter what services or support your event may need, the AGZone at the South Florida Fairgrounds has a professional staff ready to assist you in any way possible. Support services, security, carpentry, ticket-takers, parkers, special electrical needs, tables, chairs, signage and graphics and full catering services are but a few of the many services that we offer to make your event as successful as possible. Book your event now! of Transcript FACT SHEET Combined AGZone at the South Florida Fairgrounds Completed in December 2002. First occupancy: 2003 South Florida Fair, January 17 — February 2, 2003. 51,000 usable square feet of exhibit space. Hook-ups for electricity, telecommunications, water and sewer. Excellent event lighting. Ample loading and unloading areas. Accessible restrooms. Parking for 6,000 vehicles. Easy access from major highways with a minimum of traffic congestion in and out of Fairgrounds. Large Animal Barn 30,000 total square feet. 27,000 square feet of barn/exhibit area. State-of-the-art milking display area with a 4 stall Bo-Matic milking system. High clear span ceiling to center — No interior columns or obstructions. Finished sealed concrete floor with built-in electricity, water and sewer. Bank of restrooms. Ample loading and unloading doors. Large Animal Show Ring 24,000 square feet mixed footing arena.10-1/2’ open sides. 32’ High clear span ceiling to center — No interior columns or obstructions. of Transcript Floor Plans Animal Barn Arena #yesteryearvillage Download our fair app Sign up for email updates from South Florida Fair & Palm Beach County Expositions, Inc. Florida’s rich history in your own backyard!  When visitors walk into Yesteryear Village, they are transported to a different time.  A time when schools were located in one small building, houses did not have running water and when people had goats, chickens and sheep in their backyard. We offer four (4) different volunteer opportunities during our Living History Park, Thursday, Friday or Saturday - 10 AM - 4 PM: 1st Person Interpreter 3rd Person Interpreter Village Volunteer Shadow Volunteer Volunteers will explain heritage, history and historical concepts to the 		visitors or assist staff with special projects. Training provided. Special Events of Transcript Fright Nights 2024 October 4-5, 10-12, 17-19, 24-26 Be a part of South Florida’s greatest collection of freaks, zombies, and monsters. Hours are from 6pm-11pm (12am on Friday & Saturday) Haunted houses open at 7pm This event is recommended for teens and adults. Volunteers work closely with staff and will be assigned to a haunted house or scare zone. Volunteers under 16 years old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian who is also a registered volunteer. Stay tuned for our casting call at the IThink Financial Amphitheatre. Unable to attend the Fright Nights Casting Call? No worries. Just complete the Volunteer Application below and put “FRIGHT NIGHTS” in the box when asked where you would like to volunteer. Spookyville 2024 October 18-20, 25-27, and 31 Hours: Fridays: 5pm-9pm Saturdays and Sundays: 11am-6pm Spookyville is an old fashion Halloween in Yesteryear Village for families and children 10 and under.  This event offers a full array of safe trick-or-treats, scarecrow making, kiddie rides, games, and arts & crafts. It is a traditional Halloween in a fun, secure and family friendly environment.  Volunteers are assigned along the trick-or-treat trail distributing candy and/or small prizes or helping young guests prepare an arts and craft project.  Period clothing and/or family friendly Halloween costumes are encouraged, but not required to volunteer during Spookyville. Sweet Corn Fiesta April 2025 This annual event is held in April in Yesteryear Village.  Volunteers are appointed to help with children’s games or stationed in one of our historic buildings communicating Florida history to our guests. Fact sheet are available.  Period clothing is encouraged but not required to volunteer during the Sweet Corn Fiesta. of Transcript 2025 Fair: January 17-FEBRUARY 2 of Transcript 1 of 3 of Transcript Guest Services (Must be a Senior in High School to volunteer for Guest Services) Volunteers provide the Fair customer with important information to help make their visit a rewarding experience.  Training provided. Yesteryear Village Volunteers will explain heritage, history, and historical concepts to the visitors.  Informational fact sheets are available upon request. Dress code: Period clothing or a volunteer t-shirt and black or khaki pants, finger-tip length shorts or skirts. Blue jeans are also acceptable. Volunteers will explain heritage, history and historical concepts to the visitors.  Informational fact sheets are available upon request. South Florida Fair Kid's mile January 18, 2025 Volunteers are needed as monitors, cheerleaders, and runners. Monitors will be stationed throughout the mile course making sure the children do not make a wrong turn. Cheerleaders are stationed throughout the course encouraging the 2,000+ registered children. Runners will be running alongside the children and help serve as a monitor and cheerleader. All volunteers may also be asked to assist with registration, parking, set-up/clean-up, and generally helping answer questions from the children and their parents. Parade CROWD CONTROL Volunteers will work closely with staff and will be walking along the parade route to help the parade run smoothly  stock floats with beads.  Please wear comfortable shoes. Volunteers are needed Monday – Friday at 5:30 p.m. and Saturday and Sunday at 12:00 p.m. for approximately two (2) hours each day. We would love for you to join our Fair Family!!!! just fill out the volunteer Application below! of Transcript New Volunteer Application IMPORTANT: Fill this form ONLY IF YOU ARE applying for the first time. Thank you for your interest in becoming a South Florida Fair volunteer! PLEASE NOTE: Volunteers UNDER THE AGE OF 18 - Parent or legal guardian must give written permission by filling out and signing this form by checking the box below. Permission to volunteer with the South Florida Fair & Palm Beach County Expositions, Inc. * Date Child's Grade and School Child's Date of Birth Parent/Guardian Information Home Phone Work Phone Cell Phone By clicking this box, I certify that the information above is true and complete. I understand this is not a contract of employment and that as a volunteer, I am not an employee of the South Florida Fair and Palm Beach County Expositions, Inc. and I will not receive compensation for my services. I understand and agree that a criminal history and background check will be conducted on all volunteer applicants. Any volunteer working with cash will be required to have a credit check completed. I also understand that, if selected, I may need to participate in a volunteer orientation before beginning to serve and should any accident or injury occur to me or others while volunteering; I will immediately notify an employee of the South Florida Fair. I realize that any conduct detrimental to the best interests of the South Florida Fair and/or its patrons may result in my immediate removal from the South Florida Fair program. I understand that my photograph may be taken and utilized and that my contact information may be shared with the South Florida Fair, its employees or agents. Experience Fright Nights Behind The Scenes FAQs Directions Haunts & Scare Zones  > 2025 Haunts Past Haunts Cast  > Icon Characters Featured Characters About Us Buy Tickets Search Website Search Area Weather Buy Tickets Search Website Search Buy Tickets Search Website Search Hours & Directions Login Our Partners Buy Tickets Search Website Search Tickets Home > South Florida Fair > Get involved > Volunteer Opportunities for High School Students Year-Round Volunteer Opportunties of Transcript 1 of 3 of Transcript Living History Park IN YESTERYEAR VILLAGE Yesteryear Village is open every Thursday, Friday and Saturday operating as A Living History Park from 10:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m.  This is a unique opportunity for visitors to chat with the town residents (volunteers) and listen as they talk about what their daily life was really like prior to 1940.  Florida’s rich history in your own backyard!  When visitors walk into Yesteryear Village, they are transported to a different time.  A time when schools were located in one small building, houses did not have running water and when people had goats, chickens and sheep in their backyard. We offer four (4) different volunteer opportunities during our Living History Park, Thursday, Friday or Saturday - 10 AM - 4 PM: 1st Person Interpreter 3rd Person Interpreter Village Volunteer Shadow Volunteer Volunteers will explain heritage, history and historical concepts to the 		visitors or assist staff with special projects. Training provided. Special Events of Transcript Fright Nights 2024 October 4-5, 10-12, 17-19, 24-26 Be a part of South Florida’s greatest collection of freaks, zombies, and monsters. Hours are from 6pm-11pm (12am on Friday & Saturday) Haunted houses open at 7pm This event is recommended for teens and adults. Volunteers work closely with staff and will be assigned to a haunted house or scare zone. Volunteers under 16 years old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian who is also a registered volunteer. Stay tuned for our casting call at the IThink Financial Amphitheatre. Unable to attend the Fright Nights Casting Call? No worries. Just complete the Volunteer Application below and put “FRIGHT NIGHTS” in the box when asked where you would like to volunteer. Spookyville 2024 October 18-20, 25-27, and 31 Hours: Fridays: 5pm-9pm Saturdays and Sundays: 11am-6pm Spookyville is an old fashion Halloween in Yesteryear Village for families and children 10 and under.  This event offers a full array of safe trick-or-treats, scarecrow making, kiddie rides, games, and arts & crafts. It is a traditional Halloween in a fun, secure and family friendly environment.  Volunteers are assigned along the trick-or-treat trail distributing candy and/or small prizes or helping young guests prepare an arts and craft project.  Period clothing and/or family friendly Halloween costumes are encouraged, but not required to volunteer during Spookyville. Sweet Corn Fiesta April 2025 This annual event is held in April in Yesteryear Village.  Volunteers are appointed to help with children’s games or stationed in one of our historic buildings communicating Florida history to our guests. Fact sheet are available.  Period clothing is encouraged but not required to volunteer during the Sweet Corn Fiesta. of Transcript 2025 Fair: January 17-FEBRUARY 2 of Transcript 1 of 3 of Transcript Guest Services (Must be a Senior in High School to volunteer for Guest Services) Volunteers provide the Fair customer with important information to help make their visit a rewarding experience.  Training provided. Yesteryear Village Volunteers will explain heritage, history, and historical concepts to the visitors.  Informational fact sheets are available upon request. Dress code: Period clothing or a volunteer t-shirt and black or khaki pants, finger-tip length shorts or skirts. Blue jeans are also acceptable. Volunteers will explain heritage, history and historical concepts to the visitors.  Informational fact sheets are available upon request. South Florida Fair Kid's mile January 18, 2025 Volunteers are needed as monitors, cheerleaders, and runners. Monitors will be stationed throughout the mile course making sure the children do not make a wrong turn. Cheerleaders are stationed throughout the course encouraging the 2,000+ registered children. Runners will be running alongside the children and help serve as a monitor and cheerleader. All volunteers may also be asked to assist with registration, parking, set-up/clean-up, and generally helping answer questions from the children and their parents. Parade CROWD CONTROL Volunteers will work closely with staff and will be walking along the parade route to help the parade run smoothly  stock floats with beads.  Please wear comfortable shoes. Volunteers are needed Monday – Friday at 5:30 p.m. and Saturday and Sunday at 12:00 p.m. for approximately two (2) hours each day. Who We Are skip to main content Search Website Search Hours & Directions Area Weather About Who We Are Our Mission Statement Staff Letter From the Manager History of Fairs Facebook Instagram Plan Your Visit Indian River County Youth Livestock and Horticulture General Fair Information Fair Map Ride Height Requirements Ride Safety Tips Entertainment Get Updates Attractions Get Involved Competitive Exhibits and Contests Sponsors Volunteering Vendors Buy Tickets Home > About > Who We Are Who We Are Originally organized in 1980 as the “Vero Beach Firefighters County Fair”, our event has grown from a 6-day program which ran from April 15–20, 1980 at the Vero Beach Airport, to the present 10 days of family fun. The first General Manager of the fair was Fire Lieutenant Bill Tripp. Bill served in that position until 1988 when Fire Lieutenant Joe Earman Jr. took the reins and operated the event until 1995. In 1996 Fire Lieutenant Toby Turner then stepped up and performed the General Manager’s roll for 19 years. Since 2015, Fire Department Battalion Chief Wayne Howard serves as the General Manager and operates with an annual budget in excess of $250,000. In 1985, Indian River County set aside land to be used as a permanent site for the County Fairgrounds. This present location of 7955 58th Avenue has 45 acres of fenced area and 30 acres for parking. It serves the county, not only by leasing to the firefighters’ for the fairs operation, but the county uses the grounds and its facilities to host other events as well as leasing them to other organizations or clubs. The site also serves as an emergency staging point for disaster relief efforts. In 1986, the Indian River County Commission asked the firefighters to submit an application for funds with the State of Florida to assist in future improvements to the fairgrounds. So then, was the “Indian River County Fair Association” chartered. Following guidelines set aside by the state of Florida under state statute 616, Indian River County receive funds to construct and improve the facilities on this property. The Indian River County Fair Association, subcontracts with the Vero Beach Firefighters Association to operate their annual event. The Indian River County Fair Association has a 25 member Board who along with the general manager and the 11-committee directors are responsible for the fairs daily operation. The fair pays Indian River County 10% of its gross revenue for use of the facilities. Net proceeds benefit various local charities. The fairground continues to develop in a forward progress. There have been updates to the electrical stations, agricultural building and IRCYLH parking areas as well as the campground. Monies from lessors of the property go back into the facilities so improvements can continue. In 2008, the Indian River County Commission approved a request to fund a master plan for the fairgrounds. This master site plan will provide the information needed to allow the facilities and grounds to grow at an appropriate pace. Site infrastructure, campground facilities, patron safety, vehicle parking, pedestrian entry points, restrooms, midway operations and roadway concerns will be addressed. HOWEVER; this plan was pulled from funding when the economic conditions worsened in this county. The fair board and its directors continue to pursue its re-instatement for public viewing and discussion during our current fair season. With an average attendance of 50,000 patrons, the Firefighters’ Fair offers an environment of family fun and entertainment. While showcasing the youth of Indian River County in livestock and agriculture, we also provide a sense of self-esteem to every child. The feeling, which arises from accomplishing something and being rewarded for that accomplishment is very satisfying; we believe hundreds of youth over the years have come away from the fair “as winners”. The Firefighters’ Fair is proud to be associated with and members of; the International Association of Fairs, the Florida Federation of Fairs, the Florida Festivals & Events Association, the Outdoor Amusement Business Association as well as our local Chamber of Commerce. Our organization will continue to provide the finest in wholesome family entertainment while showcasing local talent, agriculture, local livestock, commercial and educational information to the citizens of this county. of Transcript Third Alarm Sponsors (772) 571-3247 info@firefightersfair.org P.O. CURRENT OPENINGS of Transcript PUBLIC SAFETY DEPARTMENT Event Security Officer This position reports directly to the on-duty Security Supervisor and will be responsible for ensuring the general safety of guests, vendors and employees; while patrolling assigned areas to prevent theft, violence, or infractions of rules. Security Officers also control access to areas within the Fairgrounds, as well as other duties as assigned. DESIRED SKILLS AND EDUCATION: Security Officers must be at least 21 years of age. Security Officers should possess a high school diploma or GED certificate. Security Officers should possess a valid Florida Driver License. Security Officers must be able to speak, understand and write in the English language. Must pass a background check and drug screen. Must have a reliable means of communication. Must have a reliable means of transportation. Must have the legal right to work in the United States. Must be able to perform routine foot patrol and do moderate lifting. Second languages, in addition to English, are a valuable asset and while not required are desired. Certifications in first aid, CPR, EMT, and or Paramedic are not required for hire, but are desired. PLEASE NOTE: Incomplete applications will not be considered. It has a Board of Trustees comprised of seventeen (17) individuals who are responsible for setting policy and seeing that management of the association is carried out under direction of an executive staff consisting of the President/CEO and at present, a Vice President and four Division Directors. The Fair also has Directors who serve in an advisory capacity. There are presently fifty-five (55) Directors. The Trustees and Directors are non-paid volunteers.
The day-to-day operation is the responsibility of the President, Matt Wallsmith, who oversees a staff of over 45 full-time employees. MISSION STATEMENT The South Florida Fair & Palm Beach County Expositions, Inc is a private, non-profit corporation whose expectation is to preserve and promote the agricultural, trade, entertainment, and historical heritage of our community. THE FAIRGROUNDS Approximately 135 acres comprise the real property commonly referred to as the "Fairgrounds". In 1957, Palm Beach County gave the Fair 100 acres at its present site but later took back 20 acres for the stockade. This contribution was made in consideration of the Fair agreeing to relocate from John Prince Park in order that the County could vie for a state university (PBCC). Generally, the Fairgrounds is segregated into several pods or tracts: the parking tracts, Yesteryear Village, the  iTHINK Financial Amphitheatre, and the exhibit buildings, including the Expo Center and the AGZone. The space available on the Fairgrounds for trade shows and exhibits exceeds 200,000 square feet.
During the annual South Florida Fair, the southern parking tract is utilized as the "midway" containing rides, shows, games, and concessions. THE EVENTS AT THE FAIRGROUNDS The main event on the Fairgrounds is the annual South Florida Fair which occurs over a 17 day period, generally in the last two (2) weeks of January each year.
Over the past several years, the annual fair has incorporated a theme as a means of stimulating tourism as well as the educational and cultural interest of the residents of Palm Beach County. For instance, "Florida" was featured at the 1998 fair and "Alaska", "Tales of the American West", "New England", "Hollywood", "Having a Ball", "Dreams, screams, thrills, chills", "Party with the Animals", "Washington D.C." and "Las Vegas" were showcased in previous fairs. One of the greatest aspects of the annual fair is its agricultural and livestock exhibits which clearly provide the greatest variety of such exhibits anywhere within Palm Beach County. Even though agriculture is such a tremendous part of Palm Beach County’s economic base, many school children have never been exposed to it. However, at the annual South Florida Fair, not only can they see and learn all about agriculture, but can even witness a calf being born, or learn how a dairy is operated.
The annual fair attracts over 500,000 people through its turnstiles. However, 650,000 people will attend various events on the Fairgrounds on an annual basis. Besides the 128,000 ft. Expo Center, there are 10 other smaller exhibit buildings along with the  iTHINK Financial Amphitheatre, AGZone and Yesteryear Village. These events constitute 250 event days. of Transcript Join Our Team! That's enough for over 150 ten-by-ten exhibit booths, a large automotive or boat show and a variety of other events looking to attract a large audience. AGZone SERVICES & SUPPORT No matter what services or support your event may need, the AGZone at the South Florida Fairgrounds has a professional staff ready to assist you in any way possible. Support services, security, carpentry, ticket-takers, parkers, special electrical needs, tables, chairs, signage and graphics and full catering services are but a few of the many services that we offer to make your event as successful as possible. Book your event now! of Transcript FACT SHEET Combined AGZone at the South Florida Fairgrounds Completed in December 2002. First occupancy: 2003 South Florida Fair, January 17 — February 2, 2003. 51,000 usable square feet of exhibit space. Hook-ups for electricity, telecommunications, water and sewer. Excellent event lighting. Ample loading and unloading areas. Accessible restrooms. Parking for 6,000 vehicles. Easy access from major highways with a minimum of traffic congestion in and out of Fairgrounds. Large Animal Barn 30,000 total square feet. 27,000 square feet of barn/exhibit area. State-of-the-art milking display area with a 4 stall Bo-Matic milking system. High clear span ceiling to center — No interior columns or obstructions. Finished sealed concrete floor with built-in electricity, water and sewer. Bank of restrooms. Ample loading and unloading doors. Large Animal Show Ring 24,000 square feet mixed footing arena.10-1/2’ open sides. 32’ High clear span ceiling to center — No interior columns or obstructions. of Transcript Floor Plans Animal Barn Arena #yesteryearvillage Download our fair app Sign up for email updates from South Florida Fair & Palm Beach County Expositions, Inc. From Turnpike North: Exit #99, Okeechobee Blvd. in West Palm Beach. Go west 1.5 miles. Turn left on Sansbury's Way and go south approximately 1 mile.
